title: Tavro Agent Metadata Specification
description: A standardized framework for defining AI Agent identity, configuration, lineage, and risk controls as published by Tavro AI, LLC.

identification.description: Core identifying and descriptive details of the agent.

agent_id.description: A unique, permanent identifier for the agent (e.g., HR-POL-003).

agent_version.description: The current version number of the agent's configuration and logic.

title.description: The human-readable name of the agent.

description.description: A concise summary of the agent's purpose, capabilities, and target user.

goal_orientation.description: The specific objective or success metric the agent is designed to achieve.

instruction.description: Detailed operational instructions that define the agent's objectives, rules, workflow steps, and execution constraints.

role.description: The defined character or communication style that governs its interaction.

owner.description: The team or department responsible for the agent's maintenance and cost.

tags.description: A list of keywords for search and categorization.

reviewer.description: Name of the person who approved the latest governance status.

created_date.description: The date when the agent was created first.

created_by.description: The team or department who created the agent.

last_updated_date.description: The date when the agent was last updated.

last_updated_by.description: The team or department who last updated the agent.

configuration.description: Technical architecture and underlying components of the Agent.

llm_model.description: The specific foundational model used by the agent (e.g., gemini-2.5-flash).

prompt_template_reference.description: The ID of the template used for guiding LLM behavior.

access_scope.description: The agent's overall data access level (e.g., LOW_PRIVILEGE).

memory_storage_reference.description: The external system used for long-term data/vector storage.

memory_type.description: The type of memory storage used (e.g., VECTOR_DB, KEY_VALUE_STORE).

data_freshness_policy.description: The maximum acceptable age of the data (caching policy) for the source.

autonomy_level.description: The degree to which the agent can act independently without human approval.

reasoning_model.description: The underlying logic or planning paradigm (e.g., ReAct, ReWOO).

multimodal_capability.description: The types of input the agent can process.

knowledge_sources.description: Information resources the Agent relies upon.

identifier.description: A Unique ID for the knowledge source.

name.description: Name of specific data sources (e.g., databases, documents).

access_mechanism.description: Protocol or service used to retrieve knowledge (e.g., REST API).

identifier.description: Unique reference ID for the tool.

allowed_delegates.description: List of Agent IDs allowed for delegation.

business_process.description: Business processes that consume the agent.

identifier.description: Reference to an application CMDB ID.

data_lineage.description: Mapping of decision paths from source to target objects.

risks.description: Consolidated view of risks (Compliance, Cyber, Responsible AI, etc.).

controls.description: Controls designed to mitigate identified risks.

risk_identifier.description: List of risk IDs this control mitigates.

aivss.description: AI Vulnerability Scoring System (AIVSS) assessment including AARS attributes and security scoring.
